utterances.U2: Doctor: What brings you here today?
utterances.U3: Patient: I have a fever and a sore stomach. Okay, Tony.
utterances.U4: Doctor: I see your temperature is 104 degrees. That's very high.
utterances.U5: Patient: Yes, I feel very dizzy and nauseous. Did you get sick?
utterances.U6: Patient: Yes, I vomited twice this morning. Did you have any diarrhea? Yes,
utterances.U7: Doctor: a little bit. Did you take any medicine to treat your symptoms? No, doctor.
utterances.U8: Patient: I didn't take anything. Okay,
utterances.U9: Doctor: sounds like you may have some food poisoning. Oh, no.
utterances.U10: Doctor: Take this medicine now and again every six hours until it's finished. You'll be okay. You'll be okay in about 24 hours. That's
utterances.U11: Patient: a relief. Thank you very much, doctor. Thank you, doctor.

S.sentence_text: Patient, Tony McKay, presents with a fever and sore stomach.
He reports feeling dizzy and nauseous.
He has vomited twice this morning.
He denies taking any medicine to treat symptoms.

O.sentence_text: Physical examination reveals a temperature of 104 degrees.
He has a history of vomiting and diarrhea.

A.sentence_text: Primary diagnosis is a high temperature and fever, secondary to food poisoning.
Differential diagnoses could include other causes of symptoms, but these are not considered at this time.

P.sentence_text: The patient is advised to take a six-hour course of anti-diarrheal medication every six hours until it is finished.
He will be treated with a 24-hour course of anti-diarrheal medication.
The patient is advised to report any new symptoms within 24 hours.
